verses.text: 運約櫃進殿那時，所羅門把以色列的長老、各支派的首領和以色列的族長，都召集到耶路撒冷自己面前，要把耶和華的約櫃從大衛城，就是錫安運上來。

words.note: Grammatical particle, 'to take'
Lit. 'senior old'
Lit. 'covenant chest'

verses.text: 於是，在以他念月，就是七月，在守節期的時候，以色列眾人都聚集到所羅門王那裡。

words.note: Hebrew name for the seventh month

verses.text: 以色列的眾長老都來到了，祭司們就把約櫃抬起來。

words.note: Lit. 'manager of sacrifices'

verses.text: 祭司和利未人把耶和華的約櫃、會幕和會幕裡的一切聖器具都運上來。

words.note: Lit. 'gathering tent'
Locative particle

verses.text: 所羅門王和聚集到他那裡的以色列全體會眾，都一同在約櫃前獻牛羊為祭，數目多得不可勝數，無法計算。

words.note: Used as a locative suffix here
Common pair for livestock
Connects verb/adj to a result/degree complement
Lit. 'cannot be counted completely'
Lit. 'no way/method'

verses.text: 祭司把耶和華的約櫃抬進內殿為它預備的地方，就是至聖所，放在兩個基路伯的翅膀底下。

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb
Refers to the sacred chest containing the stone tablets
Refers to the Holy of Holies in the Temple
The innermost chamber of the tabernacle or temple
Celestial beings, usually depicted with wings

verses.text: 因為基路伯展開翅膀在約櫃所在地的上面，遮掩約櫃和抬櫃的槓。

words.note: Literally 'place where it is'
Refers to the act of carrying the Ark
Poles used to carry the Ark

verses.text: 這些槓很長，在內殿前的聖所可以看見槓頭，在殿外卻看不見；直到今日，這些槓還在那裡。

words.note: The outer chamber of the sanctuary, before the Most Holy Place

verses.text: 約櫃裡面只有兩塊石版，這兩塊石版在以色列人出埃及地以後，耶和華與他們立約的時候，摩西在何烈山放在那裡的。

words.note: Here '在...以後' means 'after'

verses.text: 祭司從聖所裡出來的時候，有雲彩充滿耶和華的殿，
因為雲彩的緣故，祭司不能站立服事，因為耶和華的榮光充滿了聖殿。

words.note: Lit. 'holy hall'

verses.text: 那時，所羅門說：「耶和華曾說，他要住在密雲中。
現在我果然為你建造了一座巍峨的殿，作你永遠的居所。」
於是王把臉轉過來，為全體以色列會眾祝福，全體以色列會眾都站著。

words.note: Abbreviation for 'Second Chronicles' (歷代志下)
Verb with directional complement

verses.text: 所羅門說：「耶和華以色列的 神是應當稱頌的，因為他親口對我父親大衛應許過的，現在他親手成全了。他說：

words.note: Often preceded by a space in some Bible editions for reverence.
Lit. 'personally by mouth'
Lit. 'personally by hand'

verses.text: 『自從我把我的子民以色列領出埃及的日子以來，我未曾在以色列的各支派中揀選一座城，建造殿宇，作我名的居所；但我揀選了大衛治理我的子民以色列。』

words.note: Often used with 自從 (zìcóng) to form a time phrase.

verses.text: 我父大衛心裡有意要為耶和華以色列的 神的名建殿。

words.note: A blank space used in some Chinese Bibles for reverence to God's name.

verses.text: 但耶和華對我父大衛說：『你心裡有意為我的名建一座殿，你這心意是好的。
然而你不要建造這殿，只有你親生的兒子，他必為我的名建造這殿。』
現在耶和華已經實現了他說過的話，我已經起來繼承我父大衛，坐在以色列的王位上，正如耶和華所說過的。我也已經為耶和華以色列的 神的名建造了這殿。

words.note: A blank space used in some Chinese Bibles for reverence to God's name.

verses.text: 我又為約櫃預備了一個地方。這約櫃裡有耶和華的約，就是他領我們列祖出埃及地的時候與他們所立的。」

words.note: Refers to the sacred chest containing the tablets of the Law.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Used to nominalize a verb or verb phrase.

verses.text: 所羅門當著以色列的全體會眾，站在耶和華的祭壇前，向天伸開雙手，

words.note: Abbreviation for 'Second Book of Chronicles'.

verses.heading: Solomon Prays for Israel

verses.text: 禱告說：「耶和華以色列的 神啊，天上地下沒有別的神像你；你對一心在你面前行事為人的僕人守約施慈愛。

words.note: Capitalized as a proper noun referring to the God of Israel.
Refers to one's moral conduct or way of life.
A compound phrase emphasizing faithfulness and compassion.

verses.text: 你謹守了你應許過你僕人我父大衛的話。你親口說過，也親手作成，正如今天一樣。
耶和華以色列的 神啊，現在求你謹守你應許你僕人我父親大衛的話：『只要你的子孫謹守他們的行為，像你在我面前所行的一樣，就必不斷有人坐以色列的王位。』

words.note: Used to nominalize a verb or verb phrase.

verses.text: 以色列的 神啊，現在求你成就你應許你僕人我父大衛的話吧！

words.note: Often capitalized 'God' in Christian contexts.
Can be a verb 'to promise' or noun 'a promise'.

verses.text: 「 神真的住在地上嗎？看哪！天和天上的天尚且不能容納你，何況我建造的這殿呢？

words.note: The preceding space `　` is for reverence, not part of the character.
Forms '真的' (zhēnde) meaning 'really'.
An interjection primarily found in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 然而耶和華我的 神啊，求你垂顧你僕人的禱告和懇求，垂聽你僕人今天在你面前所作的呼籲和禱告。

words.note: Implies a superior looking down kindly upon an inferior.
Implies a superior listening to an inferior with favor.
Forms a nominalizer, similar to 'that which'.

verses.text: 願你的眼睛晝夜看顧這殿，看顧你所說『我的名要留在那裡』的地方。願你垂聽你僕人向這地方所發的禱告。

words.note: A somewhat literary term for 'all the time'.

verses.text: 你僕人和你的子民以色列向這地方禱告的時候，求你垂聽他們的懇求。求你在天上的居所垂聽，垂聽而赦免。

words.note: Combines with 時候 to mean 'when'.
Connects clauses, often implying sequence or consequence.

verses.text: 「如果有人得罪他的鄰居被迫起誓，他來到這殿在你的祭壇前起誓的時候，

words.note: Commonly used in religious contexts for 'sin against'.
Often found in legal or religious contexts for formal oaths.
Often found in legal or religious contexts for formal oaths.

verses.text: 求你在天上垂聽，採取行動，審判你的僕人，定惡人有罪，使他所行的，都歸到他自己的頭上。定義人有理，照著他的公義賞賜他。

words.note: Often refers to God's dwelling place.
Used when a superior (e.g., God) listens to an inferior.
Forms a noun phrase when preceding a verb, meaning 'that which'.

verses.text: 「你的子民以色列若是得罪了你，以致在仇敵面前被打敗，又回轉歸向你，承認你的名，在這殿裡向你禱告懇求的時候，

words.note: Commonly used in the Bible for God's chosen people.
Commonly used in religious contexts for 'sin against'.

words.definition: so that, with the result that

words.note: Often implies repentance or turning back to God.
Specifically implies turning towards a particular direction or entity.

verses.text: 求你在天上垂聽，赦免你的子民以色列的罪，領他們返回你賜給他們列祖之地。

words.note: Often refers to God's dwelling place.
Used when a superior (e.g., God) listens to an inferior.
Commonly used in the Bible for God's chosen people.
Formal term for bestowing a gift or favor, often by a superior.
Classical possessive particle, similar to 'de'.

verses.text: 「如果他們因為得罪了你，天就閉塞不下雨；他們若是向這地方禱告，承認你的名；又因你苦待他們，就離開他們的罪，

words.note: Commonly used in religious contexts for 'sin against'.
Can refer to the physical sky or to God/Heaven as a divine entity.

verses.text: 求你在天上垂聽，赦免你僕人和你的子民以色列的罪，指示他們當行的善道，賜雨水在你的地上，就是你賜給你子民的產業之地。

words.note: Lit. 'above heaven'
Implies God condescending to listen.
Often used for God's chosen people.
Often combined with '的' for adjectival use, e.g., 'that which should be walked'.
Literally 'land of inheritance'.

verses.text: 「如果這地有饑荒、瘟疫、旱風、霉爛、蝗蟲、螞蚱，或有仇敵把他們圍困在城裡，無論遭遇甚麼災禍，甚麼疾病，
你的子民以色列，或是眾人，或是個人，知道自己心裡的苦痛，向這殿伸開雙手所作的一切禱告、一切懇求，

words.note: Precedes a verb to form a nominalized phrase, e.g., 'what is done'.

verses.text: 求你在天上你的居所垂聽而赦免，並且採取行動。你是知道人心的，只有你知道萬人的心，求你照著各人所行的報應他，

words.note: Used to emphasize a descriptive phrase.
Precedes a verb to form a nominalized phrase, e.g., 'what is done'.
Can be positive or negative, depending on context.

verses.text: 好使他們在你賜給我們列祖的地上，一生一世敬畏你。

words.note: Literally 'one life, one generation', implying for all time.

verses.text: 「至於不屬於你的子民以色列的外族人，為了你的名的緣故從遠地而來，

words.note: Refers to the people of a ruler or nation.

verses.text: 因為他們聽到你的大名、大能的手和伸出來的膀臂，他們來向這殿禱告的時候，

words.note: Often refers to God's omnipotence.
Verb-object compound: to offer a report/prayer.

verses.text: 求你在天上你的居所垂聽，照著外族人向你呼求的一切而行，好使地上的萬族萬民都認識你的名，敬畏你，像你的子民以色列一樣；又使他們知道我建造的這殿是稱為你的名下的。

words.note: Implies a higher being listening to a lower one.
Lit. 'ten thousand clans, ten thousand people'.

verses.text: 「如果你的子民出去與仇敵爭戰，無論你派他們到哪處，他們若是向你所揀選的這城，並向我為你的名建造的這殿禱告，

words.note: Indicates the preceding noun/pronoun is the agent of the following verb.

verses.text: 求你在天上垂聽他們的禱告和懇求，為他們主持公道。
「如果你的子民得罪了你（沒有不犯罪的世人），你向他們發怒，把他們交給仇敵，以致仇敵把他們擄到仇敵的地方，或是遠或是近，

words.note: Refers to subjects of a ruler or God's people.

verses.text: 在被擄的地方，他們若是回心轉意，在他們被擄去之地回轉，向你祈求，說：『我們犯了罪了；我們犯了過了，我們作了惡事。』

words.note: Lit. 'return heart turn mind'.
Literary usage, equivalent to '的'.
Refers to a moral failing or sin.

verses.text: 如果他們在俘擄他們的仇敵的地方，一心一意回轉歸向你，又向著你賜給他們列祖的地方，向你所揀選的這城，和我為你的名建造的這殿禱告，

words.note: Often used in religious context meaning 'turn to God'.
Formal term for giving, often by a superior or divine being.
Often refers to patriarchs in a biblical context.
Used to form a noun phrase from a verb or verb phrase, often implying passive voice.
Commonly used for divine selection in scripture.
Refers to the Temple in a biblical context.
Primarily used in religious contexts.

verses.text: 求你在天上你的居所垂聽他們的禱告和懇求，為他們主持公道。

words.note: Often refers to 'Heaven' as God's abode.
Formal term, often refers to God's dwelling.
Implies a superior (like God) graciously listening to a subordinate.
Formal word for pleading or earnest prayer.

verses.text: 赦免得罪了你的子民，又赦免他們冒犯你的一切過犯，使他們在擄他們的人面前蒙憐憫。

words.note: Commonly used for divine forgiveness in scripture.
Refers specifically to moral or spiritual failings.
Formal, often indicates receiving something from a superior or divine source.
Often refers to divine mercy in religious contexts.

verses.text: 因為他們是你的子民、你的產業，是你從埃及、從鐵爐中領出來的。

words.note: Refers to a ruler's or God's subjects.
In biblical context, often refers to God's chosen people as His heritage.
A metaphor for severe affliction or oppression, especially in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 願你睜開眼睛看顧你僕人的祈求，和你的子民以色列的祈求，他們向你呼求的，願你都垂聽。

words.note: Implies a benevolent and protective oversight.
Lit. 'condescend to listen'; implies a superior listening to an inferior's plea.

verses.text: 主耶和華啊！因為你已經把他們從地上萬族萬民中分別出來，作自己的產業，正如你領我們的列祖出埃及的時候，藉著你的僕人摩西所應許的。」

words.note: A title of reverence for God or Jesus.
Often paired with 萬民 to mean all humanity/nations.
Often paired with 萬族 to mean all humanity/nations.

verses.text: 所羅門在耶和華的祭壇前屈膝下跪，向天伸開雙手，向耶和華獻完了這一切禱告和懇求以後，就起來，

words.note: Often used in formal or respectful contexts, like prayer.
Emphasizes the act of lowering oneself to a kneeling position.

verses.text: 站著，大聲給以色列的全體會眾祝福，說：
「耶和華是應當稱頌的。他照著自己一切所應許的，賜安息給他的子民以色列人。藉著他的僕人摩西所應許一切美好的話，一句都沒有落空。

words.note: Specifically used for praising God.
Forms a nominalized clause with the following verb.
Refers to God's promises.
Often refers to Sabbath rest or spiritual rest.
Refers to God's chosen people.
Often refers to God's servants.
Used with a negative verb to mean 'not a single word'.

verses.text: 願耶和華我們的 神與我們同在，像與我們的列祖同在一樣。願他不離棄我們，也不撇下我們。

words.note: Expresses a wish or desire.
Used as a proper noun for God.
Often describes God's presence.
Refers to the ancient patriarchs.
Similar to 離棄, often used together for emphasis.

verses.text: 願他使我們的心歸向他，遵行他的一切道，謹守他吩咐我們列祖的誡命、律例和典章。

words.note: Often used for turning to God.
Often used for obeying God's commands.
Refers to God's ways or teachings.
Used for meticulously obeying laws or commands.
One of three types of Mosaic law.
One of three types of Mosaic law.
One of three types of Mosaic law.

verses.text: 願我在耶和華面前懇求的這些話，晝夜都不離耶和華我們的 神，好使他天天為他僕人和他的子民以色列人主持公道，

words.note: Often means 'in God's presence'.

verses.text: 使地上萬族萬民都知道耶和華是 神，除他以外沒有別的神。

words.note: Refers to all ethnic groups or nations.
Often paired with 萬族, meaning 'all humanity'.
Used with '除' to mean 'except for'.
Used here as a common noun for 'a god'.

verses.text: 所以你們的心要完全歸給耶和華我們的 神，遵行他的律例，謹守他的誡命，像今天一樣。」

words.note: The space before 神 is a common rendering in some Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 王和所有與他在一起的以色列人都在耶和華面前獻祭。

words.note: Abbreviation for 歷代志下 (Lìdàizhì Xià).

verses.heading: Solomon Dedicates the Temple

verses.text: 所羅門向耶和華獻平安祭，牛二萬二千頭，羊十二萬隻；這樣，王和以色列眾人為耶和華的殿舉行了奉獻典禮。

words.note: Measure word for cattle and other large animals.
Measure word for various animals, especially birds.

verses.text: 那一天，因為耶和華面前的銅祭壇太小，容不下燔祭、素祭和平安祭牲的脂肪，王就把耶和華殿前院子當中的地方分別為聖，在那裡獻燔祭、素祭和平安祭牲的脂肪。

words.note: A common phrase in religious texts meaning 'to sanctify' or 'to hallow'.

verses.text: 那時所羅門與從哈馬口直到埃及小河的以色列人，都在耶和華我們的 神面前舉行盛大的集會，守節七天，又七天，一共十四天。

words.note: Also translated as 'entrance of Hamath'.
The space before 神 is a common rendering in some Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 到了第八天，王遣散了眾人；眾人都祝福過王以後，就高高興興地回自己的家去。他們因為看見耶和華向他僕人大衛和他子民以色列所施的一切恩惠，心中都感到歡喜。

words.note: Often used for dismissing staff or crowds.
Common in religious contexts, means 'to give a blessing'.
Reduplication emphasizes the adjective, forming an adverb.
Transliteration of the Hebrew name for God.
Often refers to a servant of God or a king.
Often used for God's chosen people.
Can refer to the nation, land, or people of Israel.
Forms a nominal phrase with the verb it precedes.
Formal verb for 'to give' or 'to apply'.
Key theological term meaning 'divine favor'.
Indicates an internal feeling or thought.
